001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
005import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont;
006import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont.BitmapFontData;
007import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFontCache;
008import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.GlyphLayout;
009import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShapeRenderer;
010import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShapeRenderer.ShapeType;
011import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
012import com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor;
013import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Align;
014import squidpony.panel.IColoredString;
015import squidpony.panel.IMarkup;
016
017import java.util.ArrayDeque;
018import java.util.Iterator;
019
020/**
021 * An actor capable of drawing {@link IColoredString}s; it has been superseded by the newer
022 * {@link TextPanel} and does not draw colors currently due to a libGDX bug. It is
023 * lines-oriented: putting a line may erase a line put before. It is designed to write text
024 * with a variable-width font (as opposed to {@link SquidPanel}). It performs line wrapping
025 * by default. It can write from top to bottom or from bottom to top (the default).
026 * 
027 * <p>
028 * The libGDX bug that affects IColoredString drawing here does not affect TextPanel, and
029 * has been fixed in nightly builds but is not working in a stable release. It is expected
030 * to be fixed in the release after 1.9.10, barring some sort of regression.
031 * </p>
032 * 
033 * <p>
034 * This class is usually used as follows:
035 * 
036 * <pre>
037 * final int nbLines = LinesPanel.computeMaxLines(font, pixelHeight);
038 * final LinesPanel<Color> lp = new LinesPanel(new GDXMarkup(), font, nbLines);
039 * lp.setSize(pixelWidth, pixelHeight);
040 * stage.addActor(lp);
041 * </pre>
042 * </p>
043 * 
044 * <p>
045 * Contrary to {@link SquidMessageBox}, this panel doesn't support scrolling
046 * (for now). So it's suited when it is fine forgetting old messages (as in
047 * brogue's messages area).
048 * </p>
049 * 
050 * @author smelC
051 * @param <T>
052 *
053 * @see TextPanel A preferred, newer alternative that also can show variable-width fonts.
054 * @see SquidMessageBox An alternative, doing similar lines-drawing business,
055 *      but being backed up by {@link SquidPanel} and so limited to fixed-width fonts.
056 * @deprecated You should prefer {@link TextPanel} for new code.
057 */
058@Deprecated
059public class LinesPanel<T extends Color> extends Actor {
060
061        /** The markup used to typeset {@link #content}. */
062        protected final IMarkup<T> markup;
063
064        /** The font used to draw {@link #content}. */
065        protected final BitmapFont font;
066
067        /** An alternative to {@link #font}, used to draw {@link #content}. */
068        protected final TextCellFactory tcf;
069
070        /** What to display. Doesn't contain {@code null} entries. */
071        protected final ArrayDeque<IColoredString<T>> content;
072
073        /** The maximal size of {@link #content} */
074        protected final int maxLines;
075
076        /**
077         * The renderer used by {@link #clearArea(Batch)}. Do not access directly:
078         * use {@link #getRenderer()} instead.
079         */
080        protected /* @Nullable */ ShapeRenderer renderer;
081
082        /**
083         * The horizontal offset to use when writing. If you aren't doing anything
084         * weird, should be left to {@code 0}.
085         */
086        public float xOffset = 0;
087
088        /**
089         * The vertical offset to use when writing. If you aren't doing anything
090         * weird, should be left to {@code 0}.
091         */
092        public float yOffset = 0;
093
094        /**
095         * If {@code true}, draws:
096         * 
097         * <pre>
098         * ...
099         * content[1]
100         * content[0]
101         * </pre>
102         * 
103         * If {@code false}, draws:
104         * 
105         * <pre>
106         * content[0]
107         * content[1]
108         * ...
109         * </pre>
110         */
111        public boolean drawBottomUp = false;
112
113        /**
114         * The color to use to clear the screen before drawing. Set it to
115         * {@code null} if you clean on your own.
116         */
117        public Color clearingColor = Color.BLACK;
118
119        /* Now comes the usual libgdx options */
120
121        /** Whether to wrap text */
122        public boolean wrap = true;
123
124        /** The alignment used when typesetting */
125        public int align = Align.left;
126
127        /**
128         * @param markup
129         *            The markup to use, or {@code null} if none. You likely want to
130         *            give {@link GDXMarkup}. If non-{@code null}, markup will be
131         *            enabled in {@code font}.
132         * @param font
133         *            The font to use.
134         * @param maxLines
135         *            The maximum number of lines that this panel should display.
136         *            Must be {@code >= 0}.
137         * @throws IllegalStateException
138         *             If {@code maxLines < 0}
139         */
140        public LinesPanel(/* @Nullable */ IMarkup<T> markup, BitmapFont font, int maxLines) {
141                this.markup = markup;
142                this.font = font;
143                this.tcf = null;
144                if (maxLines < 0)
145                        throw new IllegalStateException("The maximum number of lines in an instance of "
146                                        + getClass().getSimpleName() + " must be greater or equal than zero");
147                this.maxLines = maxLines;
148                this.content = new ArrayDeque<>(maxLines);
149        }
150        /**
151         * @param markup
152         *            The markup to use, or {@code null} if none. You likely want to
153         *            give {@link GDXMarkup}. If non-{@code null}, markup will be
154         *            enabled in {@code font}.
155         * @param font
156         *            The font to use as a TextCellFactory, typically for distance field fonts.
157         * @param maxLines
158         *            The maximum number of lines that this panel should display.
159         *            Must be {@code >= 0}.
160         * @throws IllegalStateException
161         *             If {@code maxLines < 0}
162         */
163
164        public LinesPanel(/* @Nullable */ IMarkup<T> markup, TextCellFactory font, int maxLines) {
165                this.markup = markup;
166                this.tcf = font;
167                this.font = font.bmpFont;
168                if (maxLines < 0)
169                        throw new IllegalStateException("The maximum number of lines in an instance of "
170                                        + "LinesPanel must be greater or equal than zero");
171                this.maxLines = maxLines;
172                this.content = new ArrayDeque<>(maxLines);
173        }
174
175        /**
176         * Used to help find the last parameter to give the constructor of this class.
177         * @param font the font being used
178         * @param height the height of the area you want to put text into
179         * @return The last argument to give to
180         *         {@link #LinesPanel(IMarkup, BitmapFont, int)} when the
181         *         desired <b>pixel</b> height is {@code height}
182         */
183        public static int computeMaxLines(BitmapFont font, float height) {
184                return MathUtils.ceil(height / font.getData().lineHeight);
185        }
186
187        /**
188         * Used to help find the last parameter to give the constructor of this class.
189         * @param tcf the TextCellFactory being used
190         * @param height the height of the area you want to put text into
191         * @return The last argument to give to
192         *         {@link #LinesPanel(IMarkup, BitmapFont, int)} when the
193         *         desired <b>pixel</b> height is {@code height}
194         */
195        public static int computeMaxLines(TextCellFactory tcf, float height) {
196                return MathUtils.ceil(height / tcf.lineHeight);
197        }
198
199        /**
200         * Adds {@code ics} first in {@code this}, possibly removing the last entry,
201         * if {@code this}' size would grow over {@link #maxLines}.
202         *
203         * @param ics an IColoredString of the same color type as this LinesPanel; must be non-null
204         */
205        public void addFirst(IColoredString<T> ics) {
206                if (ics == null)
207                        throw new NullPointerException("Adding a null entry is forbidden");
208                if (atMax())
209                        content.removeLast();
210                content.addFirst(ics);
211        }
212
213        /**
214         * Adds {@code ics} last in {@code this}, possibly removing the first entry,
215         * if {@code this}' size would grow over {@link #maxLines}.
216         *
217         * @param ics an IColoredString of the same color type as this LinesPanel; must be non-null
218         */
219        public void addLast(IColoredString<T> ics) {
220                if (ics == null)
221                        throw new NullPointerException("Adding a null entry is forbidden");
222                if (atMax())
223                        content.removeFirst();
224                content.addLast(ics);
225        }
226
227        /**
228         * Change the first entry in {@code this} to  {@code ics}, overwriting the existing
229         * first entry if present.
230         * @param ics an IColoredString of the same color type as this LinesPanel; must be non-null
231         */
232        public void setFirst(IColoredString<T> ics)
233        {
234                if (ics == null)
235                        throw new NullPointerException("Adding a null entry is forbidden");
236                if(!content.isEmpty())
237                        content.removeFirst();
238                content.addFirst(ics);
239        }
240
241        /**
242         * Change the last entry in {@code this} to  {@code ics}, overwriting the existing
243         * last entry if present.
244         * @param ics an IColoredString of the same color type as this LinesPanel; must be non-null
245         */
246        public void setLast(IColoredString<T> ics)
247        {
248                if (ics == null)
249                        throw new NullPointerException("Adding a null entry is forbidden");
250                if(!content.isEmpty())
251                        content.removeLast();
252                content.addLast(ics);
253        }
254
255        /**
256         * Draws this LinesPanel using the given Batch.
257         * <br>
258         * This will set the shader of {@code batch} if using a distance field or MSDF font and the shader is currently not
259         * configured for such a font; it does not reset the shader to the default so that multiple Actors can all use the
260         * same shader and so specific extra glyphs or other items can be rendered after calling draw(). If you need to draw
261         * both a distance field font and full-color art, you should set the shader on the Batch to null when you want to
262         * draw full-color art, and end the Batch between drawing this object and the other art.
263         *
264         * @param batch a Batch such as a {@link FilterBatch} that must be between a begin() and end() call; usually done by Stage
265         * @param parentAlpha currently ignored
266         */
267        @Override
268        public void draw(Batch batch, float parentAlpha) {
269                clearArea(batch);
270
271                final float width = getWidth();
272                if(tcf != null)
273                        tcf.configureShader(batch);
274
275                final BitmapFontData data = font.getData();
276                final float lineHeight = data.lineHeight;
277                final float height = lineHeight * maxLines;
278
279                final float x = getX() + xOffset;
280                //TODO: check if drawBottomUp is correct or if lineHeight should be changed to 0
281                float y = getY() + (drawBottomUp ? lineHeight : height - lineHeight) - data.descent + yOffset;
282
283                final Iterator<IColoredString<T>> it = content.iterator();
284//              int ydx = 0;
285                float consumed = 0;
286                while (it.hasNext()) {
287                        final IColoredString<T> ics = it.next();
288                        //final String str = toDraw(ics, ydx);
289                        /* Let's see if the drawing would go outside this Actor */
290                        final BitmapFontCache cache = font.getCache();
291                        cache.clear();
292                        final GlyphLayout glyph = cache.setText(ics.present(), 0, 0, width, align, wrap);
293                        if (height < consumed + glyph.height)
294                                /* We would draw outside this Actor's bounds */
295                                break;
296                        final int nbLines = MathUtils.ceil(glyph.height / lineHeight);
297                        /* Actually draw */
298                        ////TODO: BitmapFontCache.setColors(float, int, int) is broken in libGDX 1.9.10; find some workaround 
299//                      int ci = 0;
300//                      ArrayList<IColoredString.Bucket<T>> frags = ics.getFragments();
301//                      for (int i = 0; i < frags.size(); i++) {
302//                              final IColoredString.Bucket<T> b = frags.get(i);
303//                              cache.setColors(b.getColor(), ci, ci += b.length());
304//                      }
305                        cache.setPosition(x, y);
306                        cache.draw(batch);
307                        y -= nbLines * lineHeight;
308                        consumed += nbLines * lineHeight;
309                        //ydx++;
310                }
311        }
312
313        /**
314         * Paints this panel with {@link #clearingColor}
315         */
316        protected void clearArea(Batch batch) {
317                if (clearingColor != null) {
318                        batch.end();
319                        UIUtil.drawRectangle(getRenderer(), getX(), getY(), getWidth(), getHeight(), ShapeType.Filled,
320                                        clearingColor);
321                        batch.begin();
322                }
323        }
324
325        protected boolean atMax() {
326                return content.size() == maxLines;
327
328        }
329        
330        /**
331         * If you want to grey out "older" messages, you would do it in this method,
332         * when {@code ydx > 0} (using an {@link squidpony.IColorCenter} maybe ?).
333         * 
334         * @param ics an IColoredString with the same generic color type as this LinesPanel
335         * @param ydx
336         *            The index of {@code ics} within {@link #content}.
337         * @return A variation of {@code ics}, or {@code ics} itself.
338         */
339        protected IColoredString<T> transform(IColoredString<T> ics, int ydx) {
340                return ics;
341        }
342
343        protected ShapeRenderer getRenderer() {
344                if (renderer == null)
345                        renderer = new ShapeRenderer();
346                return renderer;
347        }
348
349}
